availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Tarvin (Kenton County, Kentucky, resident and notary public)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, resident and notary public. Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, native. Married to Eliza Pryor Tarvin. Father of James Tarvin and Jennie Tarvin. Resident of Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household employed Solomon Bradley as a servant in Covington in 1860. Notary public in Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 2, p. 610.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 244A.
W.H. Perrin, J.H. Battle, and G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 7th edition, (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battery and Company, 1887), p. 896.
“Wm. H. Tarvin Dies in Hospital,” The Cincinnati Enquirer(Cincinnati, Ohio), July 09, 1914.
